DataElement.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 1 Have Pain Other Than Everyday Kind of Pain Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of whether or not pain, other than everyday kinds of pain such as minor headaches, sprains, and toothaches, is being experienced today, using a yes or no response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Have Pain Other Than Everyday Kind of Pain
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._A question about whether an individual has or had pain other than everyday kinds of pain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Have Pain Other Than Everyday Kind of Pain
Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.:A question about whether an individual has or had pain other than everyday kinds of pain.

Concepts.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.

Concepts.longName: Have Pain Other Than Everyday Kind of Pain
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had pain other than everyday kinds of pain.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ClassificationSchemeItems.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form - CDISC Aligned

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3966605 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Throughout our lives, most of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches). Have you had pain other than these everyday kinds of pain today?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Questionnaire BPI Short Form Test Code Terminology
ReferenceDocuments.description: Test codes of questionnaire questions associated with the short-form brief pain inventory for the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Standard Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
